processed_mails.subject: AIVoiceChat
processed_mails.content:
Hey,

I stumbled across your Youtube videos showcasing some of the AI tools you
have made. I starred, thanks for open sourcing :). Anyway, I plan on
implementing something similar to AIVoiceChat into my program (using
ElevenLabs + GPT-4 Turbo). Is it up to date for those models with the
RealtimeSTT and RealtimeTTS repos or should I take the time and rewrite it
so to use them. Would it even improve latency if I did? Every ounce of
latency is critical., trying to sound as natural as possible.

Also, I saw RealtimeSTT changed the sentence color once finalized. Would
you recommend using that same logic to detect when a user is done asking a
question/saying something? Or is there another possible lower latency
solution?

Thanks,
Ethan Creel
Hey,

  

I stumbled across your Youtube videos showcasing some of the AI tools you have
made. I starred, thanks for open sourcing :). Anyway, I plan on implementing
something similar to AIVoiceChat into my program (using ElevenLabs + GPT-4
Turbo). Is it up to date for those models with the RealtimeSTT and RealtimeTTS
repos or should I take the time and rewrite it so to use them. Would it even
improve latency if I did? Every ounce of latency is critical., trying to sound
as natural as possible.

  

Also, I saw RealtimeSTT changed the sentence color once finalized. Would you
recommend using that same logic to detect when a user is done asking a
question/saying something? Or is there another possible lower latency
solution?

  

Thanks,

Ethan Creel
processed_mails.summary: Ethan Creel is seeking advice on implementing AIVoiceChat into his program using ElevenLabs + GPT-4 Turbo. He is inquiring about the RealtimeSTT and RealtimeTTS repos and their relevance to the models, as well as the potential improvement in latency. Additionally, he is seeking recommendations for detecting when a user is done asking a question or saying something.

mails.subject: AIVoiceChat
mails.content_html:
Hey, I stumbled across your Youtube videos showcasing some of the AI tools you have made. I starred, thanks for open sourcing :). Anyway, I plan on implementing something similar to AIVoiceChat into my program (using ElevenLabs + GPT-4 Turbo). Is it up to date for those models with the RealtimeSTT and RealtimeTTS repos or should I take the time and rewrite it so to use them. Would it even improve latency if I did? Every ounce of latency is critical., trying to sound as natural as possible. Also, I saw RealtimeSTT changed the sentence color once finalized. Would you recommend using that same logic to detect when a user is done asking a question/saying something? Or is there another possible lower latency solution? Thanks, Ethan Creel Hey,

I stumbled across your Youtube videos showcasing some of the AI tools you have made. I starred, thanks for open sourcing :). Anyway, I plan on implementing something similar to AIVoiceChat into my program (using ElevenLabs + GPT-4 Turbo). Is it up to date for those models with the RealtimeSTT and RealtimeTTS repos or should I take the time and rewrite it so to use them. Would it even improve latency if I did? Every ounce of latency is critical., trying to sound as natural as possible.

Also, I saw RealtimeSTT changed the sentence color once finalized. Would you recommend using that same logic to detect when a user is done asking a question/saying something? Or is there another possible lower latency solution?

Thanks,
Ethan Creel
